pros: Teamwork, flexible,supportive, fast paced and manageable
cons: None great place to work learn

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Sacramento, CA
pros: Pension Salary competitive for Sacramento Nice facility Parking is affordable (should be free) Good resources for nurses
cons: Not a magnet (Does not care about RN vs BSN Favoritism Go out of legal CA nurse to patient ratios often due to lack of staff Management audits things that essentially is not priority (seems like they have free time on their hands) Nurses who are Floating to units are picked by manager audits even though they are there to help the unit. Management micromanages

job_title: Neuro ICU RN in Sacramento, CA
pros: The hospital is very nice looking.
cons: Management only focuses on the negative. The unit has a click with long term night shift people. If you don’t get a long with them then you “don’t work well with others.”
Having to float to other units

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Sacramento, CA
pros: Lots of autonomy. Workload is appropriate for quality patient care.

review_title: Administration at Sutter General Hospital is incompetent and detached from the realities of patient care.
pros: Many talented surgeons and anesthesiologists. Qualified and talented nurses used to seek employment at Sutter General.
cons: The nursing director of the operating room at Sutter General Hospital has managed to run all of the strong, talented, and qualified nurses and techs out of Sutter. Her mismanagement of the operating room has resulted in increased turn over and the lowest morale in a work environment that we have ever witnessed.

pros: Good state of the art building and equipment good parking. Good location and good cafeteria. Most coworkers are supportive. Appears perfect
cons: If you get written up for anything they will most likely fire you. Very hostile Managment. Very important to watch your back to protect your job. Lower pay than most of Bay Area.

pros: Pay was great, benefit was good.
cons: Girls will dislike you for no reason

pros: Decent pay for being an RN
